radiologyReportTO.title: SPINE LUMBOSACRAL MIN 2 VIEWS
radiologyReportTO.text:
SPINE LUMBOSACRAL MIN 2 VIEWS
Exm Date: SEP 24, 2004@11:25 Req Phys: FELKLEY,KENNETH E Pat Loc: PCT_O PATIL (F/U) (Req'g Loc) Img Loc: RADIOLOGY Service: Unknown
(Case 1582 COMPLETE) SPINE LUMBOSACRAL MIN 2 VIEWS (RAD Detailed) CPT:72100 Proc Modifiers : BILATERAL EXAM
Clinical History: having 3 weeks of back pains need to re-eval for arhritis or any worsneing disc spaces etc.
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: SEP 27, 2004 Date Verified: SEP 28, 2004 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/Thong D. Nguyen, M.D.
Report: Three views of the lumbosacral spine are compared with a previous examination of 9/23/02.
There has been a partial collapse of L2 which is similar in appearance and degree to the previous examination of September 2002. There is also collapse of the body of T12 which apparently is new since the previous exam and the collapse has been estimated above 75 to 80% of the height of the vertebral body.
There is mild marginal spurring of the upper anterior aspect of L4. There are arteriosclerotic calcifications in the abdominal aorta and branches.
The intervertebral disc spaces are preserved.
Impression: 1. Old compression fracture of L2 with anterior marginal spurring and apparent ankylosis L1-L2.
2. Collapse or compression fracture of the body of T12 which is new since the previous examination in 2002 and involves loss of height of that vertebral body by about 70%. Arteriosclerotic calcifications of the aorta.
Primary Diagnostic Code:
Primary Interpreting Staff: FELIX GARFUNKEL, Staff Physician VERIFIED BY: THONG NGUYEN, Radiologist/Chief
/GEG

type.name: RADIOLOGIC EXAMINATION, SPINE, LUMBOSACRAL; 2 OR 3 VIEWS

radiologyReportTO.title: CHEST 2 VIEWS PA&LAT
radiologyReportTO.text:
CHEST 2 VIEWS PA&LAT
Exm Date: SEP 23, 2002@11:37 Req Phys: PATIL,SARASWATI Pat Loc: PCT_O PATIL (F/U) (Req'g Loc) Img Loc: RADIOLOGY Service: Unknown
(Case 360 COMPLETE) CHEST 2 VIEWS PA&LAT (RAD Detailed) CPT:71020
Clinical History: pt c/o cough for wks ,not clearing. r/o infiltrate.
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: SEP 25, 2002 Date Verified: SEP 26, 2002 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/J.E. Sutton, M.D.
Report: PA and lateral of the chest are compared to an earlier examination dated 12/4/00. Once again, we see chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. The apices of both lungs show fibrocalcific changes compatible with old granulomatous disease. The hilar regions have been retracted cephalad. Several deformities from old healed rib fractures are seen on the right.
A comparison with the earlier examination shows no interval change.
Impression: 1. COPD. Old granulomatous disease.
Primary Diagnostic Code:
Primary Interpreting Staff: JOSEPH SUTTON, Radiologist (Verifier) /GEG

type.name: RADIOLOGIC EXAMINATION, CHEST, 2 VIEWS, FRONTAL AND LATERAL;

radiologyReportTO.title: SPINE LUMBOSACRAL MIN 2 VIEWS
radiologyReportTO.text:
SPINE LUMBOSACRAL MIN 2 VIEWS
Exm Date: SEP 23, 2002@11:37 Req Phys: PATIL,SARASWATI Pat Loc: PCT_O PATIL (F/U) (Req'g Loc) Img Loc: RADIOLOGY Service: Unknown
(Case 363 COMPLETE) SPINE LUMBOSACRAL MIN 2 VIEWS (RAD Detailed) CPT:72100
Clinical History: pt c/o pain in lower back ? pulled muscle. r/o disc disease.
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: SEP 25, 2002 Date Verified: SEP 26, 2002 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/J.E. Sutton, M.D.
Report: An old compression fracture of L2 is observed. The pedicles are intact and disc spaces are well maintained. Changes of spondylosis are seen at L3, L4 and L5.
Impression: 1. Lumbar spondylosis is seen and there is an old compression fracture of L2.
Primary Diagnostic Code:
Primary Interpreting Staff: JOSEPH SUTTON, Radiologist (Verifier) /GEG

type.name: RADIOLOGIC EXAMINATION, SPINE, LUMBOSACRAL; 2 OR 3 VIEWS

imagingExamTO.name: MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION (SPECT), EX/REDIST, W/ W/O PHARM INTER

radiologyReportTO.title: MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION (SPECT), EX/REDIST, W/ W/O PHARM INTER
radiologyReportTO.text:
MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION (SPECT), EX/REDIST, W/ W/O PHARM INTER
Proc Ord: MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION, PHARMACOLOGICAL STRESS P/D Exm Date: APR 26, 2001@11:07 Req Phys: PATIL,SARASWATI Pat Loc: PCT_O PATIL (F/U) (Req'g Loc) Img Loc: NUCLEAR MEDICINE Service: Unknown
(Case 1516 COMPLETE) MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION (SPECT), EX/(NM Detailed) CPT:78465
(Case 1519 COMPLETE) #PROVISION OF DIAGNOSTIC RADIONUC(NM Detailed) CPT:78990
(Case 1520 COMPLETE) MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION STUDY WITH E(NM Detailed) CPT:78480
( 4x ) J1245 DIPYRIDAMOLE INJECTION (NM Detailed) CPT:J1245
( 3x ) A9505 THALLOUS CHLORIDE TL 201/MC(NM Detailed) CPT:A9505
(Case 1536 COMPLETE) MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION STUDY WITH W(NM Detailed) CPT:78478
(Case 1544 COMPLETE) CARDIOVASCULAR STRESS TEST (TECH)(NM Detailed) CPT:93015
Clinical History: PT C/O C.P ON & OFF,OLD MI, FAMILY H/O HEART ATTACK. R/O CAD
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: APR 26, 2001 Date Verified: APR 27, 2001 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/NEIL KATZ, MD
Report: REPORT: 4/26/01 ANTRAS, J. #6267 41.4 mg Dipyridamole IV injected in right arm at 0958-1002 hours by Dr. Katz. 3.16 mCi Tl.201 Chloride injected IV in right arm at 1005 hours by A. Bender.
INTRAVENOUS DIPYRIDAMOLE STRESS THALLIUM MYOCARDIAL SCAN-SPECT:
The dipyridamole stress test was performed in the NMS.
Both stress and rest images reveal mild decreased activity in the inferior wall. However, gated images reveal normal wall motion in this area.
There is a post-Dipyridamole thallium left ventricular ejection fraction of 73%.
Impression: No evidence for reversible ischemia. The mild persistent decreased activity in the inferior wall may be secondary to soft tissue attenuation, especially since the wall motion is normal in this area.
Primary Diagnostic Code:
Primary Interpreting Staff: NEIL KATZ, CHIEF, NMS (Verifier) /MAC

type.name: MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION IMAGING; TOMOGRAPHIC (SPECT), MULTIPLE STUDIES (INCLUDING ATTENUATION CORRECTION WHEN PERFORMED), AT REST AND/OR STRESS (EXERCISE AND/OR PHARMACOLOGIC) AND REDISTRIBUTION AND/OR REST INJECTION, WITH OR WITHOUT QUANTIFICATION

imagingExamTO.name: MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION STUDY WITH WALL MOTION

radiologyReportTO.title: MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION STUDY WITH WALL MOTION
radiologyReportTO.text:
MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION STUDY WITH WALL MOTION
Proc Ord: MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION, PHARMACOLOGICAL STRESS P/D Exm Date: APR 26, 2001@11:07 Req Phys: PATIL,SARASWATI Pat Loc: PCT_O PATIL (F/U) (Req'g Loc) Img Loc: NUCLEAR MEDICINE Service: Unknown
(Case 1516 COMPLETE) MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION (SPECT), EX/(NM Detailed) CPT:78465
(Case 1519 COMPLETE) #PROVISION OF DIAGNOSTIC RADIONUC(NM Detailed) CPT:78990
(Case 1520 COMPLETE) MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION STUDY WITH E(NM Detailed) CPT:78480
( 4x ) J1245 DIPYRIDAMOLE INJECTION (NM Detailed) CPT:J1245
( 3x ) A9505 THALLOUS CHLORIDE TL 201/MC(NM Detailed) CPT:A9505
(Case 1536 COMPLETE) MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION STUDY WITH W(NM Detailed) CPT:78478
(Case 1544 COMPLETE) CARDIOVASCULAR STRESS TEST (TECH)(NM Detailed) CPT:93015
Clinical History: PT C/O C.P ON & OFF,OLD MI, FAMILY H/O HEART ATTACK. R/O CAD
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: APR 26, 2001 Date Verified: APR 27, 2001 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/NEIL KATZ, MD
Report: REPORT: 4/26/01 ANTRAS, J. #6267 41.4 mg Dipyridamole IV injected in right arm at 0958-1002 hours by Dr. Katz. 3.16 mCi Tl.201 Chloride injected IV in right arm at 1005 hours by A. Bender.
INTRAVENOUS DIPYRIDAMOLE STRESS THALLIUM MYOCARDIAL SCAN-SPECT:
The dipyridamole stress test was performed in the NMS.
Both stress and rest images reveal mild decreased activity in the inferior wall. However, gated images reveal normal wall motion in this area.
There is a post-Dipyridamole thallium left ventricular ejection fraction of 73%.
Impression: No evidence for reversible ischemia. The mild persistent decreased activity in the inferior wall may be secondary to soft tissue attenuation, especially since the wall motion is normal in this area.
Primary Diagnostic Code:
Primary Interpreting Staff: NEIL KATZ, CHIEF, NMS (Verifier) /MAC

type.name: MYOCARDIAL PERFUSION STUDY WITH WALL MOTION, QUALITATIVE OR QUANTITATIVE STUDY (LIST SEPARATELY IN ADDITION TO CODE FOR PRIMARY PROCEDURE)

radiologyReportTO.title: CHEST 2 VIEWS PA&LAT
radiologyReportTO.text:
CHEST 2 VIEWS PA&LAT
Exm Date: DEC 14, 2000@08:49 Req Phys: PACHECO,JAIME Pat Loc: ZZZHEMATOLOGY II (Req'g Loc) Img Loc: RADIOLOGY Service: Unknown
(Case 767 COMPLETE) CHEST 2 VIEWS PA&LAT (RAD Detailed) CPT:71020 Proc Modifiers : LEFT
Clinical History: granulomata?
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: DEC 14, 2000 Date Verified: DEC 18, 2000 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/Michael McVeigh MD
Report: PA AND LATERAL CHEST: 12-14-00:
The study was compared to that of 7-31-00.
Examination reveals retraction of both hila superiorly with pleuroparenchymal scarring. There are scattered fibronodular changes in the left upper lobe particularly but also in the right upper lobe but there is again no significant interval change from the previous study. Several old rib fractures are noted on the right and there is a generalized bony demineralization consistent with osteoporosis.
There is mild compression of several mid thoracic vertebral bodies essentially unchanged from that of the previous study.
Impression: There is evidence for COPD and retraction of the hila bilaterally which most likely represents old healed granulomatous infection. These findings are unchanged from the previous study.
Primary Diagnostic Code:
Primary Interpreting Staff: MICHAEL MCVEIGH, CHIEF,RADIOLOGY SERVICE (Verifier) /RSC

type.name: RADIOLOGIC EXAMINATION, CHEST, 2 VIEWS, FRONTAL AND LATERAL;

radiologyReportTO.title: CT THORAX W/CONT
radiologyReportTO.text:
CT THORAX W/CONT
Exm Date: AUG 29, 2000@08:34 Req Phys: LODHI,ABDUL Pat Loc: ZZZHEMATOLOGY II (Req'g Loc) Img Loc: CT RADIOLOGY Service: Unknown
(Case 372 COMPLETE) CT THORAX W/CONT (CT Detailed) CPT:71260
Clinical History: H/O OF MASS ON THE CXR WHICH WAS DONE AS A PRE-OP STUDY FOR FOOT SURGERY. H/O TB -60 YRS BACK.
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: AUG 29, 2000 Date Verified: AUG 30, 2000 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/B.H.Baumann,MD.
Report: CT OF THE CHEST:
Informed consent which accompanied the patient to the CT scan suite is archived in Radiology service and available for review as desired.
Although there are no prior CT scans, plain films of the thorax did in 1994, 1997, and 1998 and most recently 7/31/00 are reviewed. All prior films demonstrate bihilar evalation and patchy central apical infiltrates with predominately nodular pattern as well as variable extensions of the clustered soft tissues toward the thickened apical pleura.
Small nodular densitie are suggested elsewhere throughout the lungs although less prominent than in the apices. Interstitium is diffusely thickened.
CT scan demonstrates findings consistent with the plain film abnormalities. There are irregularly shaped central upper thoracic/apical soft tissue densities seen centrally extending variably to the peripheral pleura. The cephalad hilar margins are elevated toward the apices and there are soft tisue densities within the mediastinum and the hila bilaterally consistent by size and configuration with lymph nodes--some with associated calcifications. The largest mediastinal/hilar suspect nodular mass is in the right hilum and measures 1.5 by 2cm. along the ventral lateral margin of the right main stem bronchus.
Small nodular densities are seen within the lung apices as well as extending to the lower lungs. Occasionial dense calcification is present within the nodules although most are noncalcified.
No dominant nodules are identified most meausurnig 5mm. or less.
Imaging into the upper abdomen demonstrates no focal lesions of either liver or spleen in their cephalad extent. The central renal cysts are noted splaying the upper collecting systems of the kidneys symmetrically. Renal function appears symmetric/good.
Impression: CT scan findings correlate well with the anatomic abnormalities of prior chest radiographs. First radiographic differential diagnosis is granulomatous disease although active disease can not be absolutely excluded.
Can not exclude the possibility of interval development of a small noncalcified nodular density concomitantly; if there is strong clinical concern- additional characterization may be warranted.
Primary Diagnostic Code: ABNORMALITY, ATTN. NEEDED
Primary Interpreting Staff: BERTA H BAUMANN, Radiologist (Verifier) /JGB

type.name: COMPUTED TOMOGRAPHY, THORAX, DIAGNOSTIC; WITH CONTRAST MATERIAL(S)

radiologyReportTO.title: FOOT 3 OR MORE VIEWS
radiologyReportTO.text:
FOOT 3 OR MORE VIEWS
Exm Date: AUG 09, 2000@13:25 Req Phys: NGUYEN,HOANG K Pat Loc: OUTPT/SURG (Req'g Loc) Img Loc: RADIOLOGY Service: Unknown
(Case 922 COMPLETE) FOOT 3 OR MORE VIEWS (RAD Detailed) CPT:73630 Proc Modifiers : PORTABLE EXAM, LEFT
Clinical History: Do portable in PACU. Pt is s/p pin removal x 2 proximal phalanx left hallux. please evaluate
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: AUG 11, 2000 Date Verified: AUG 18, 2000 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/HEMANK VARMA
Report: PORTABLE FILMS OF THE LEFT FOOT: 8-9-00: 13:05 hours:
the comparison exam is from 7-18-00.
There is osteopenia.
No plantar spur is noticed.
Two pins from the proximal phalanx of the great toe have been removed in comparison to previous examination.
There is redemonstration of at least three screws and one curved rod in the first metatarsal bone which has not changed significantly since previous exam. There is some hallux valgus deformity.
third and fourth hammer toes are noticed.
Impression: Removal of two pins from the proximal phalanx of the left great toe since previous examination.
No significant change in the appearance of the first metatarsal bone with screws and wire. Please see above for comments.
Primary Diagnostic Code:
Primary Interpreting Staff: HEMANK VARMA, Radiologist (Verifier) /RSC

type.name: RADIOLOGIC EXAMINATION, FOOT; COMPLETE, MINIMUM OF 3 VIEWS

radiologyReportTO.title: CHEST 2 VIEWS PA&LAT
radiologyReportTO.text:
CHEST 2 VIEWS PA&LAT
Exm Date: JUL 31, 2000@16:28 Req Phys: HOLGADO,RONALD Pat Loc: OUTPT/ PRE-OP TESTING (Req'g L Img Loc: RADIOLOGY Service: Unknown
(Case 312 COMPLETE) CHEST 2 VIEWS PA&LAT (RAD Detailed) CPT:71020
Clinical History: scheduled for lt. foot surgery on 8-9-00 needs pre op cxr
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: AUG 01, 2000 Date Verified: AUG 02, 2000 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/HEMANK VARMA
Report: CHEST, PA AND LATERAL: 7-31-00:
The comparison exam is from 4-8-98.
The chest appearance is consistent with COPD and old healed granulomatous disease.
There is volume loss in both lower lobes. Some dilated bronchioles are noticed in the upper lobes bilaterally. These findings were seen in the previous examination. I cannot see the soft tissue nodular density which was seen in the left upper lobe in the previous examination. This could be due to difference in positioning. There is some ill-defined density projected over the left anterior second rib but it may represent old h ealed granulomatous disease and dilated bronchioles. However, follow-up examination and, if needed, further testing may be done for evaluation of any neoplastic process as the soft tissue nodular density was noticed in the previous examination. Otherwise, I would think that probably these changes may be related to old healed granulomatous disease. There is bilateral apical pleural thickening.
Interstitial changes are noticed in the lungs.
Nodular densities are noticed in both lung fields which I think would represent old healed granulomatous disease.
Old healed fractures of multiple right ribs are noticed.
Slight central compression of some of the mid thoracic vertebral bodies is noticed.
The CP angles are clear.
Impression: Volume loss in both upper lobes with dilated bronchioles and peribronchial thickening.
COPD and nodular densities in the lungs with bilateral apical pleural thickening.
Right upper lobe soft tissue nodular density is again noticed projected between the right posterior third and fourth ribs but I cannot see the left upper lobe density which was seen in the previous examination.
The old exam of 1994 also showed changes in both upper lobes, therefore, I think most likely they represent old healed granulomatous disease. There may be some element of bronchiectasis. Follow-up examination may be helpful.
Primary Diagnostic Code:
Primary Interpreting Staff: HEMANK VARMA, Radiologist (Verifier) /RSC

type.name: RADIOLOGIC EXAMINATION, CHEST, 2 VIEWS, FRONTAL AND LATERAL;

radiologyReportTO.title: FOOT 3 OR MORE VIEWS
radiologyReportTO.text:
FOOT 3 OR MORE VIEWS
Exm Date: JUL 18, 2000@16:26 Req Phys: HYDE,TALIA Pat Loc: ZZZPODIATRY CASTING (Req'g Loc Img Loc: RADIOLOGY Service: Unknown
(Case 616 COMPLETE) FOOT 3 OR MORE VIEWS (RAD Detailed) CPT:73630 Proc Modifiers : LEFT
Clinical History: 71 year old prior history of r 1st metatarsal operation. Complaining of prominent hardware. Please evaluate. Thank you
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: JUL 19, 2000 Date Verified: JUL 24, 2000 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/THONG NGUYEN
Report: LEFT FOOT:
Examination of the left foot by multiple views showed three metallic screws and two fixation pins at the left first metatarsal. Two intramedullary fixation pin seen at the proximal phalanx of the left great toe. The hardware seen at the level of the left first metatarsal are also previous seen at the study dated 6/23/97. The two new fixation pins at the proximal phalanx of the left great toe are new. The hardware at the left first metatarsal probably are used for transfixing the fracture at the base of the metartarsal. The purpose of the two new pin at the proximal phalanx of the left great toe were not given.
Impression: Metallic screw and fixation pin at the left first metatarsal and proximal phalanx noted.
Personal evaluation of the radiograph by the clinician is advised.
Primary Diagnostic Code:
Primary Interpreting Staff: THONG NGUYEN, Radiologist/Chief (Verifier) /RSC

Proc Ord: Unknown Exm Date: APR 08, 1998@15:19 Req Phys: ALLEN,MARILYN Pat Loc: OP Unknown/09-07-2022@16:14 Img Loc: RADIOLOGY Service: Unknown
(Case 1235 COMPLETE) RIBS BILAT+CHEST 4 OR MORE VIEWS (RAD Series ) CPT:71111 Proc Modifiers : BILATERAL EXAM
Clinical History: VET FELL FLAT ON BACK ON 4-5-98, TRIPPED OVER DOG, SPECIAL ATTN TO RT POST RIBS
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: APR 09, 1998 Date Verified: APR 10, 1998 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/B.H.Baumann,MD.
Report: CHEST AND RIBS: 04/08/98:
No convincingly suspect acute rib fractures are seen. There is deformity of the posterior lateral aspect to the right 6th rib and the posterior lateral left 4th and 6th ribs consistent with remotely healed fractures.
If there is strong clinical concern of potentially undetected non-displaced fracture--additional imaging may be desired.
There is no change within the thorax to suggest potential undetected rib fracture.
There continue to be coarse trabecular nodule accentuation of the interstitium diffusely with consolidation of nodular interstitial infiltrate in both lung apices as before.
Impression: no acute fracture identified
Primary Diagnostic Code:
Primary Interpreting Staff: BERTA H BAUMANN, Radiologist (Verifier) /GEG

Clinical History: 3 VIEWS RIGHT FOOT S/P 6 WKS PLEASE STATE PROGRESSION OF HEALING OF 1ST METATARSAL
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: OCT 16, 1997 Date Verified: OCT 18, 1997 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/RICHARD C. BELLAS, M.D.
Report: RIGHT FOOT: 10-15-97:
Routine views of the right foot show the presence of a small caliber screw projecting from the dorsal to the ventral surface of the distal metaphysis of the first metatarsal bone. There is absence of the medial surface of the distal epiphysis and metaphysis of the first metatarsal compatible with previous bunionectomy. The second through the fifth metatarsals appear normal.
Impression: Evidence of previous bunionectomy involving the first metatarsal.
Fixation screw device projecting from the dorsal to the ventral surfaces of the distal end of the shaft of the first metatarsal.
Primary Diagnostic Code: MINOR ABNORMALITY
Primary Interpreting Staff: RICHARD C BELLAS, STAFF RADIOLOGIST (Verifier) /RSC

A repeat examination of the left foot is made after an interval of 7 weeks. On today's examination, the presence of a walking cast is observed. In addition to the screws and wires in the 1st metatarsal which were present previously, there are now 2 wires in the proximal phalanx of the great toe, presumably transfixing an osteotomy. Films are available for review by podiatry.
Impression: 1. Interval surgery on the proximal phalanx of the great toe and application of a walking cast.

Three views of the left foot are seen. Post-surgical changes are noted involving the first metatarsal. J-Wires and metal screws are present. Large bony defect is still quite visible near the proximal end of the bone and no evidence is seen on this study of subperiosteal new bone formation.

radiologyReportTO.text:

Proc Ord: Unknown Exm Date: MAY 12, 1997@10:08 Req Phys: HOLGADO,RONALD Pat Loc: OP Unknown/09-07-2022@16:14 Img Loc: RADIOLOGY Service: Unknown
(Case 238 COMPLETE) FOOT 3 OR MORE VIEWS (RAD Detailed) CPT:73630 Proc Modifiers : PORTABLE EXAM, LEFT
Clinical History: S/P ARTHROPLASTY OF 2ND DIGIT OF LT FOOT
!!!!!!!!!!!!! PT IN PACU WILL CALL 737 WHEN PT ARRIVES. !!!!!!!!!!!!
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: MAY 14, 1997 Date Verified: MAY 29, 1997 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/B.H.Baumann,MD.
Report: LEFT FOOT THROUGH PLASTER CAST: 5-12-97:
Comparison is made with X-Rays of 4-21-97.
Postoperative changes are noted in the first digit consisting of an osteotomy in the proximal portion of the first metatarsal which has been stabilized by two bone screws and one wire. Also, there is an additional longitudinal wire extending through the remaining length of the first metatarsal plus a single small screw in the neck of the first metatarsal. There is improvement in hallux valgus, however, one does note the presence of some degree of hammer toe deformity involving the second, third, and fourth, and perhaps also the fifth toes.
Impression: Satisfactory appearance of post-surgical residuals of hallux valgus, as described.
Primary Diagnostic Code: MAJOR ABNORMALITY, NO ATTN. NEEDED
Primary Interpreting Staff: JOHN SINGER, Staff Physician VERIFIED BY: BERTA H BAUMANN, Radiologist
/RSC

type.name: RADIOLOGIC EXAMINATION, FOOT; COMPLETE, MINIMUM OF 3 VIEWS

Report Status: Verified Date Reported: MAY 08, 1997 Date Verified: MAY 09, 1997 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/J.E.SUTTON,M.D.
Report: CHEST:
PA and lateral of the chest show changes of congestive obstructive pulmonary disease and evidence of old granulomatous disease. Interstitial fibrosis and pleural thickening at the apices can be seen. Hyperaerated lungs with flattended diaphragms are present.
Impression: Changes of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease are found and there are evidences of old granulomatous disease superimposed.
Primary Diagnostic Code:
Primary Interpreting Staff: JOSEPH SUTTON, Radiologist (Verifier) /JGB

type.name: RADIOLOGIC EXAMINATION, CHEST, 2 VIEWS, FRONTAL AND LATERAL;

radiologyReportTO.title: FOOT 3 OR MORE VIEWS
radiologyReportTO.text:
FOOT 3 OR MORE VIEWS
Proc Ord: Unknown Exm Date: APR 21, 1997@13:36 Req Phys: HOLGADO,RONALD Pat Loc: OP Unknown/09-07-2022@16:14 Img Loc: RADIOLOGY Service: Unknown
(Case 411 COMPLETE) FOOT 3 OR MORE VIEWS (RAD Detailed) CPT:73630 Proc Modifiers : BILATERAL EXAM
Clinical History: PRE-OP BUNION EVALUATION
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: APR 22, 1997 Date Verified: APR 24, 1997 Verifier E-Sig:/ES/J.E.SUTTON,M.D.
Report: BOTH FEET:
Severe changes of hallux valgus are seen bilaterally, somewhat greater on the left than on the right. The metatarsophalangeal joints show degenerative changes as well.
Impression: Severe hallux valgus, involving both feet.
Primary Diagnostic Code:
Primary Interpreting Staff: JOSEPH SUTTON, Radiologist (Verifier) /JGB

Clinical History:
Report Status: Verified Date Reported: JUL 02, 1994 Date Verified: JUL 06, 1994 Verifier E-Sig:
Report:
Impression: Normal sized heart.
Old healed granulomatous disease.
Apparently calcified granulomas projecting over the hilar regions and within the upper lobes of both lungs.

Report:
Impression: 1. Splaying of infundibula diffusely bilaterally-suggest renal pelvic lipomotosis as most common etiology-no evidence of obstruction.
